page.title: 19PUBLIC SERVICES
page.content: Every house relies on electricity, brought by overhead cables, for lighting and domestic appliances. In Linkenholt many houses have Rayburns, which burn solid fuel, for cooking and heating water; in Faccombe 2 houses use oil, but the rest have wood fired central heating. Linkenholt water is from Southern Water mains supply; a bore hole at Faccombe supplies water to Faccombe, Kimmer and Netherton. The milkman delivers bottles of milk to the door on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday; newspapers are delivered daily; the postman delivers and collects twice a day weekdays, once on Saturdays. Vernham Dean Post Office delivers groceries and pensions weekly to old-age pensioners. Most shopping is done in nearby towns. A mobile library calls fortnightly.
